news.title: Saylor's bitcoin buying strategy is 'exploding' globally, but Wall Street is skeptical
news.summary: Michael Saylor says he's seen other companies replicate his strategy of using cash to buy bitcoin. Michael Saylor applauds efforts by other companies to replicate his Strategy of Using Cash to Buy Bitcoin.

news.title: Pentagon chief says ready to 'fight and win' against China, urges Asian allies to boost defense spending
news.summary: Hegseth played up the U.S.'s enduring commitment to the Indo-Pacific region. He took swipes at the absence of China's defense minister Dong Jun.

news.title: DoorDash CEO Tony Xu is taking on the role of industry consolidator in food delivery
news.summary: DoorDash CEO Tony Xu has spent 12 years building his food delivery company from an upstart into a big acquirer. Xu: "We're in the business of making people happy. We're not in it for the money"

news.title: This is why Jamie Dimon is always so gloomy on the economy
news.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has regularly warned that the U.S. economy faces perils. But even as he sounds the alarm, his bank is doing better than ever.

news.title: Lyft is starting to make some right moves with urging from activist Engine Capital. What's next
news.summary: Ken Squire breaks down the Engine position in Lyft. Ken Squire: Lyft's Engine position will be key to the success of the company. He says the company will need to be able to compete with Uber and Lyft.

news.title: ‘The situation is extreme’: I’m 65 and leaving my estate to only one grandchild. Can the others contest my will?
news.summary: “I feel it is absolutely necessary to leave about 90% of what I have to just one grandchild,” he said.

news.title: Why the government’s debt problem is your borrowing problem — but also your opportunity to save
news.summary: People shopping for a car loan or a mortgage should understand the implications of high bond yields. People shopping for car loans or mortgages should understand high bond yield implications.

news.title: Can media company spinoffs of brands like CNN and CNBC be good for investors? Here’s what history tells us.
news.summary: Recent corporate media spinoffs have been a mixed bag, with many failing due to the way they were set up, Wall Street analysts say.

news.title: ‘I am getting very frustrated’: My mother’s adviser has not returned my calls. He manages $1 million. Is this normal?
news.summary: “I am not used to this way of doing business,” he says. “I’m not a businessman. I’ve never been in this way.” “It’s a new way of life. I don’t know what to do with it.’

news.title: These 3 corporate tax breaks in the Republican megabill look key for investors
news.summary: Many businesses have lost a trio of tax breaks that they have lost in the last few years. A key for many businesses has been to revive these tax breaks.
